intro: Jakkia longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf jakkia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Jakkia longifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
